1496278169007108099.text: So that’s my hope, my governing prayer, for 2022: that we’ll wake up every morning, channel Ted, and say “to hell with politics.” That we’ll seek common ground, find it, and in doing so, do right by the state we love and the people we serve.

1496278167467745285.text: I’m optimistic because of all the good things the delegation has been able to deliver for Alaska, and because of the resolve and resiliency of the Alaskan people. The lesson I take is that we will overcome and accomplish great things by working together.

1496278166003978247.text: That’s working together, side by side, so that we can actually get things done. Good governance. Responsible governance.

1496278164410179588.text: I don’t pretend to have all the answers for every problem that arises. No one does. But I do know a good way to find solutions.

1496274268325355524.text:
Alaskans are facing the highest inflation in 40 years. Everything costs more. Family budgets are stretched thin. And businesses big and small are struggling to find enough employees to keep their doors open.  
 
This is causing pain everywhere. We’ve got to address it.

1496270512690970629.text: The United States should halt all seafood imports from Russia until they lift their ban on ours. @SenDanSullivan & I have legislation to impose a reciprocal embargo on Russian imports. We’re pushing for it to move on a standalone basis and as part of any Russia sanctions package.

1496270510828802057.text: The recent fisheries disaster declarations bring welcome relief, albeit way too late, but still coming. This also includes the extra visas the administration is making available for seasonal workers

1496270508979101698.text: We must protect our fisheries for generations to come. We expect another incredible return in Bristol Bay, but we know we’ll need workers. We’ve secured funding for the Pacific Salmon Treaty & fisheries surveys.

1496268019491917829.text: We’ve included provisions to expand victims’ access to medical forensic exams and improve access to care for all victims of violence.

1496268017512206338.text: I’m working w/ my colleagues to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA). It includes my provisions to address teen dating violence named for Breanna Moore, who was murdered by her boyfriend in 2014.

1496265195458637830.text: Greater production of Alaska’s resources would be good news, not bad, for our efforts to address climate change. We don’t flare our gas; we re-inject it. Our production is cleaner and results in fewer emissions than most other places.

1496265193680252930.text: Between my Energy Act of 2020 & the infrastructure bill, we authorized & allocated more than $70B to new technologies. & a global phase-down of the use of ultra-warming hydrofluorocarbons will avoid up to half a degree of projected warming.

1496265191952109569.text: And every day, I remind them that refusing to permit those activities will have harmful consequences.

1496265190203138053.text: If there was ever a time for realism to prevail on resource development, it is right now. Every day, I remind the Biden administration of the immense benefits of Alaska production—energy & minerals alike.

1496265188072464389.text: There is no question the resources we have in Alaska are needed by our country and the world. Just look at oil prices, how Russia has leveraged Europe over natural gas, and soaring global demand for minerals.

1496224834703052803.text: These advances – along with the radar expansion at Clear, and the addition of new missiles for defense at Fort Greely – these are going to bring new service members to our state, along with many opportunities for civilian and support jobs.

1496224833012654088.text: We’ve directed each military service to release an Arctic strategy. And we established the Ted Stevens Center for Arctic Security Studies in Anchorage to further the Department of Defense’s focus on security cooperation in the High North.

1496224831263682565.text: Alaska remains the “most strategic place in the world.” Military commanders know that value, and we need to work with them to fulfill it.

1496222472567410689.text: A full-scale invasion would lead to a catastrophic loss of life & have massive implications for the security of Baltic states, for NATO, for the positioning of American forces around the world, and even for the Arctic and us in Alaska—given our location directly to Russia’s east.

1496222471044935687.text: As of this morning, Nord Stream 2 has been halted. Sanctions are being imposed. That's absolutely necessary. And we are entering a new phase of this crisis.

1496222469375643658.text: We’ve witnessed the largest troop buildup in Europe since World War II along Ukraine’s borders, and an invasion, and what we feared, appears to have begun. Russia is threatening not just Ukraine, but the international order and norms that have prevailed for decades.

1496222467563704324.text: Another vital aspect of Alaska’s future is with regard to our role in national defense. We’re all glued to seeing what news is coming out in regard to Russia and Ukraine.

1496220926391853065.text: My message to those who are thinking about visiting is simple: the cruise industry is taking every precaution to ensure a safe trip, and Alaska is ready to host you for the trip of your lifetime.

1496220924814798857.text: I’ve already introduced legislation to make that waiver permanent because the strength of our economy should never depend on decisions made in another country.

1496220922994429959.text: In Southeast, and all around the state, we know how hard the tourism-based economy has been hit. That’s why it was so important that we secured a waiver from the Passenger Vessel Services Act last summer, that allowed the first cruise ships to return to our ports since 2019.

1496219379314442253.text: This infrastructure bill only became law a few months ago, but it is already delivering real results. More than $600 million has already been announced for our state, from the Port of Nome to the Denali Park Road, and there is a lot more to come.

1496219378039332870.text: As we gain those benefits, we will create jobs. We will restore and grow our economy. We will improve Alaskans’ quality of life. And we’ll leave a healthier, more resilient, better developed, and still beautiful state for our children.

1496219376760016897.text: Our bipartisan infrastructure bill is now law. And over the next five years, it will bring sustained benefits to both rural and urban communities across Alaska.

1496217984859267072.text: These past two years have been hard. But as I stand in front of the Alaska State Legislature today, I’m optimistic. I believe Alaska is well-positioned for a new era of opportunity, growth, and prosperity, thanks in part to many of the actions we’ve taken in Congress.

1486536033730809861.text: The lack of an alternative to Russian oil and gas undercut some countries’ willingness to respond then, just as it does now, especially with some having doubled down on Russian supply.

After meeting with many survivors of violence in Alaska over the past few months, it’s clear the problem of family, domestic, and dating violence is getting worse. 
We have a responsibility to be involved – to help those who are most vulnerable.

1417972764712083461.text: The bill also includes a provision stemming from my bill, Bree’s Law, which addresses teen dating violence through efforts including education initiatives aimed at empowering youth, parents, and advocates.

1417972763604758529.text: Our bill enhances and expands support, protection, and prevention for Americans affected by family violence, domestic violence, and dating violence.

1417972762514186241.text:
